intro: Hieracium expansiceps, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium expansiceps is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas.
